poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Rhythm paves the way Sense is made of mops and pails In water on cement. It pares away Then planes and sands and buffs Whatever pays, whatever works. Beyond the pale's a hunger garden, Ruddy pears intact. The plains are parched A cropper prays and offers fireweed for tinder. Gods in pairs are glimpsed - if ever - through refractive panes. Give praise. Take pains. The warden preys on the redundant. His daughter plays.
